abstract.para: This document introduces basic information about &suseconnect; and how &scc; and registration servers use it to gather information about active systems and their hardware environment.

sect2.title: What is &suseconnect;?
sect2.para: &suseconnect; is a tool to register SLE-based operating systems with &scc; or other registration serve, such as &suma;, &rmt;, or ⪪. Registered systems receive updates to installed packages, for example, to increase security of the operating system. With &suseconnect;, you can additionally register extensions and modules that extend the base system's functionality.

sect2.title: Existing information
sect2.para: This document does not cover general usage of &suseconnect;. To find more basic information about how to register your system, modules, and extensions with &suseconnect;, refer to .

sect1.title: Tracking active systems
sect1.para: With newer versions of &suseconnect;, each registered host contacts &scc; or registration server automatically on a daily basis. It sends unique identification of the host and description of its hardware environment.

sect2.title: Customer benefit
sect2.para: The new functionality of &suseconnect; bring the following benefits to the customer:

listitem.para: Ability to identify all types of deployments of systems, no matter if they are derived from a custom image or clones of an already registered virtual machine.
By contacting the registration server regularly, you can obtain the number of actually running registered systems. This gives better insight into the consumption of SUSE subscriptions.
Updates to registration tools provide clearer picture of your workloads. You can filter out systems that are no longer running or decommissioned.
By collecting regular registration and hardware information, we will continue to improve our products to reflect your needs and let you manage system subscriptions more easily.

sect2.title: Prerequisites
sect2.para: In order to use the extended &suseconnect; functionality, you need to:

listitem.para: Run a supported and registered SLE-based host with all update patches applied.
Verify that the host system includes the &suseconnect; command version 0.3.33 or higher.

sect2.title: How it works
sect2.para: We extended &suseconnect; with the new option --keep-alive. The command &suseconnect; --keep-alive updates the last time that a host contacted its registration server and attaches the host's hardware information.
The &suseconnect; package ships with two &systemd; units:

listitem.para: A service which runs the command &suseconnect; --keep-alive on demand.
A timer which runs the service suseconnect-keepalive.service once a day.

sect2.para: These units are responsible for keeping the system information up-to-date with the &scc; or a registration server, and to provide accurate data about subscription usage.

note.title: The timer is enabled automatically
note.para: When the &suseconnect; package is installed or updated, and its version is equal to or greater than the one described above, the keep-alive timer will be enabled automatically.
